name: Math
details: Math is the study of numbers, quantity, space, structure, and change.

name: Physics
details: Physics is the natural science that studies matter, its motion and behavior through space and time, and the related entities of energy and force.

name: Chemistry
details: Chemistry is the scientific study of the properties and behavior of matter. It is a branch of the physical sciences which is concerned with the composition, structure, dynamics, change, and properties of matter.

name: Biology
details: Biology is the natural science concerned with the study of life and living organisms, including their structure, function, growth, evolution, distribution, and taxonomy.

name: History
details: History is the study of past events, particularly in human affairs.

name: Geography
details: Geography is the study of places and the relationships between people and their environments.

name: English
details: English is the study of language, literature, and composition, and the understanding of its various forms, structures, and contexts.

name: Astronomy
details: Astronomy is a natural science that studies celestial objects and phenomena. It uses mathematics, physics, and chemistry in order to explain their origin and evolution.

name: Computer Science
details: Computer Science is the study of computers and computational systems. It involves understanding the theory of computation, algorithms, and the design of computer systems.

name: Ecology
details: Ecology is the scientific study of interactions among organisms and their environment, such as the interactions organisms have with each other and with their abiotic environment.

name: Geology
details: Geology is the study of the Earth, the materials of which it is made, the structure of those materials, and the processes acting upon them.

name: Meteorology
details: Meteorology is the scientific study of the atmosphere that focuses on weather processes and forecasting.

educationLevels.name: Alevels
educationLevels.description: Advanced Level Qualifications, typically taken in the final two years of secondary education. Subjects are chosen by students and exams are taken at the end of the two-year course.
educationLevels.entryRequirements: Generally, at least five GCSEs at grades A* to C (9-4)

educationLevels.name: Tlevels
educationLevels.description: Technical Levels are new courses, which follow GCSEs and are equivalent to 3 A levels. They provide a mix of classroom learning and 'on-the-job' experience.
educationLevels.entryRequirements: Depends on the institution, often requires relevant GCSEs

educationLevels.name: Apprenticeships
educationLevels.description: A combination of on-the-job training and classroom learning, leading to a nationally recognised qualification. Apprentices are employed and earn a wage while learning skills.
educationLevels.entryRequirements: Varies by sector and job role, but often some relevant GCSEs or equivalent are required

educationLevels.name: BTEC
educationLevels.description: Vocational qualifications that provide specialist, work-related learning. They can be taken alongside or in place of A-levels or at further education colleges.
educationLevels.entryRequirements: Varies, but often requires 4-5 GCSEs at grades A* to C (9-4)

educationLevels.name: Foundation Degrees
educationLevels.description: Higher education qualifications that combine academic study with workplace learning. They are equivalent to two-thirds of a bachelor's degree.
educationLevels.entryRequirements: Varies, but often requires Alevels, BTEC or relevant work experience
